definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

pinyin: kong1 xiang3 she4 hui4 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Of course, this is all just a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这一切都还是空想。

sentences.english: However, in political society, theoretical designs are just reveries.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在政治社会，应然的设计成为一种空想。

sentences.english: I thought all this was simply a figment of one's imagination.
sentences.chinese: 我认为那些只不过是人们的凭空想像和虚构。

sentences.english: Was that girl wearing no blouse or was it a figment of my imagination?
sentences.chinese: 是那姑娘没穿上衣呢，还是我凭空想象的事？

sentences.english: He has a dream which is to be a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 他有一个空想，就是未来当个状师。

sentences.english: You'd better stop building castles in the air and get down to some practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你最好不要再作种种空想，该踏踏实实做些事了。

sentences.english: Constcontra -ne Tin. nosso cnosled Boss Long. Founder and owner of Drefeel.
sentences.chinese: 龙云天，又称龙老板，空想公会的创办人和具有者。

sentences.english: Backing to the childhood is just a escapism.
sentences.chinese: 回到童年仅仅就一个空想。

sentences.english: Bush's own ideological inclinations against regulation certainly contributed to the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 布什自己违反常规的空想倾向无疑造成了金融危机。

sentences.english: To die fighting side by side with warriors – a dream for any defender of his country.
sentences.chinese: 与兵士们并肩在战斗中死去，这是国家守御者的空想。

sentences.english: Without the mirror of reality, memory would be only a chimerical dream.
sentences.chinese: 而没有了现实这面镜子，记忆就只是一种空想的梦境。

sentences.english: Things are not gonna work out. He is an out and out daydreamer.
sentences.chinese: 不会成功的，他是个彻头彻尾的空想家。

sentences.english: His brain was clouded by vapours and dreams.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑子里充满空想和梦幻。

sentences.english: Change your expectations from idealistic to realistic.
sentences.chinese: 放弃不切的空想，将期望变得现实。

sentences.english: But you know we can wish our life away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，你要知道，这样的空想会空耗我们的生命。

sentences.english: Much of it is simply Utopian fiction.
sentences.chinese: 这有许多简直是乌托帮的空想。

definition: to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
